label: obj-canonical-logistic-rescale-function-example
name: Canonical Logistic Rescale Function
definition: A common and well-behaved function used to transform standardized Z-scores into positive values for fitness potential calculation. It is based on the logistic sigmoid function.
mathematical_properties: This function is infinitely differentiable (C^infinity), strictly increasing (monotonic), has a uniformly bounded range of (0, 2), and is globally Lipschitz continuous with a constant of 0.5. It satisfies all requirements of a well-behaved rescale function.
